abstracts.cdata!:
This Third Structural Adjustment Credit
            Project for Cameroon aims to lay the groundwork for a
            substantial increase in economic growth--to more than 5
            percent a year--in order to create jobs and reduce poverty.
            The adjustment program focuses on consolidating and
            deepening reforms in four areas: the transport sector, the
            privatization program (public utilities and
            agro-industries), the financial sector, and the forestry
            sector. It aims to 1) substantially lower transport costs
            and increase service availability and quality; 2) increase
            the availability of telecommunications, water, and
            electricity and the efficiency of service providers; 3)
            promote exports from the agro-industry as well as domestic
            production; 4) develop a stable and efficient financial
            sector, boost public confidence in it, and increase its
            capacity to finance productive market activity; and 5) to
            promote sustainable exploitation of Cameroon's forests,
            preserve ecological stability, promote economically
            efficient, high value-added, unsubsidized processing
            industries, and encourage forest conservation and
            management. Conditions for tranche release include: adopting
            an institutional and regulatory framework for port sector
            reform; adopting a privatization strategy for the
            electricity and telecommunications sectors; adopting
            regulations to award forestry concessions and implementing a
            tax revenue enhancement program; and better mobilizing
            non-oil revenues by improving trade and internal tax and
            budget administrati
